column4: Anyone successfully porting gnome-session through ssh -X ? I've got one gutsy one fiesty and one dapper on my lan , open ssh on each and it works great one program at a time but I want to have one machine with a gnome session of the remote machines in another f2 or f12 terminal like mentioned in http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=544567&highlight=ssh+gnome-session
right click on menus and choose edit
right click on the applications menu that is
Anyone here doing remote gnome session with ssh?
Like http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=544567&highlight=ssh+gnome-session
you can choose each time you login
default is the one it launches if you don't choose
http://gentoo-wiki.com/HOWTO_GDM_Sessions
the Exec line would be ssh -X user@host gnome-session
Amaranth thank you again !!!
make sure you can login to those machines without a password
otherwise it will mess up
I belive I tried it with  ssh -X user@host gnome-session
OK I haven't tried nopass in the config
yes but you had a gnome-session already running locally, no?
yes
this is making a separate thing you choose when you login
I wanted to have one machine at f2 another at f12 and local at f7 is what I am trying to accomplish
you could just use vnc
Going to try with ssh first. I'll read that link you sent me . Thanks
when you refer to without password do you mean the ssh_config setting ?
I mean using public/private keys to do a secure passwordless login
http://www.debuntu.org/ssh-key-based-authentication
in this case you can be fine creating a key with no password since it's all on the LAN
